intro: Agelanthus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaf agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
